Hmm. Yes. I heard about this back in November. Fortunately it's just a replica. The real shuttles are safe and secure in proper museums. The most dangerous thing they'll have to face for the rest of their days are the throngs of tourists gaping in awe and taking pictures.

Still, this is a disappointing thing to see, but hardly a surprise. As for the perpetrators, I rather expect they have very little to contribute to society as it's unlikely that they can be reeducated or reformed, but perhaps they will at least have to pay for the damages they've caused, not that they can likely afford it.
